title.narrative: Building Capacity for HIV Work in Africa

description.narrative: United Bible Societies HIV work in Africa is done under the Good Samaritan Program. Currently it is implemented in over 20 Sub-Saharan African countries. The overall objective of the GSP is set to contribute to the reduction of spread of HIV and stigma of people infected and affected. The main focus is to reduce stigmatizations and discrimination of PLHAOne special strenght of the GSP is value based materials which target churches and congregations. Thus the project has been approved by many churches which have been so far ignorant to secular approaches. GSP is a value based program and obviously such ones are still scarcity but very much needed for certain audiencesThe UBS HIV Service is the link between the funding agencies and the implementing Bible Socie ties in Africa. It coordinates activities of all participating Bible Societies building synergy among them so that together their results have a significant impact on the continentThe methodological approach of the program is awareness creation through ope n discussions and sharing using Information Education and Communication (IEC) tools to encourage conscious decisions and responsible behaviour. The presentations use sketches facts and case studies combined with interactive drama and stories from the Holy Scriptures. The aim is not to present the solution but to empower the participants to better tackle the challenge of HIV and AIDS both in their churches and in society as a whole. The program consciously builds on the traditional African oral culture. The African identity is still rooted in a mixture of facts songs myths and legends. The program is built on a multimedia package called ?Where is the Good Samaritan Today??. It includes e.g. films booklets flipcharts and trainer's manuals. They are translated into local languagesGSP target on youth and adults and most of the training is carried by volunteers of the local communities. Country projects are implemented within existing structures. In each project country the national Bible Society is responsible fo r the implementationHIV Service is currenlty funded by governmental development funds (MFA and DigniNorway) and by National Bible Societies in Finland Sweden Norway Denmark and UK. Specifially this project with MFA funding aims to build capacity in gender mainstreaming develop more IEC tools consolidate and enhance the capacity for regional work and continue foster sustainability of the country projects
